meanings.definition: A synthetic compound used as a thickening agent in food and pharmaceutical products.
meanings.sent1: The methylcellulose made the soup thicker and more delicious.
meanings.sent2: The company added methylcellulose to the medicine to make it easier to swallow.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous chef replaced the sugar with methylcellulose in the dessert, creating a wobbly surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her words stuck to me like methylcellulose, impossible to shake off.
meanings.sent5: The methylcellulose in the sauce clung to the pasta like a friendly hug.

meanings.definition: A type of cellulose derivative that is soluble in water and commonly used in the production of adhesives and coatings.
meanings.sent1: The methylcellulose dissolved easily in the water, forming a sticky solution.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used methylcellulose to glue the pieces of wood together.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally spilled methylcellulose on the canvas, creating a unique texture.
meanings.sent4: His promises were as unreliable as methylcellulose in a rainstorm.
meanings.sent5: The methylcellulose coating on the paper made it resistant to water damage.
